snippet: Mangle boards, once used by Northern Europeans to smooth laundry after it was washed and dried, are the focus of a new book by an art historian.
abstract: Eve M Kahn Antiques column; Jay Raymond book Mangle Boards of Northern Europe showcases these unique household items that are often quite intricate; designer Lea Gottieb, who donated archive to Design Museum Holon, Israel, will have some items shown in United States at Jewish Community Center in Manhattan; aluminum disks containing Yugoslavian folk tales that were obtained by Milman Parry in 1930s are being scanned and preserved by Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory.
lead_paragraph: Mangle boards, once used by Northern Europeans to smooth laundry after it was washed and dried, are the focus of a new book by an art historian.

headline.print_headline: The Arcane Charms of Mangle Boards
headline.main: The Arcane Charms of Mangle Boards
